personal.name: Marcus Roberto Nogueira
personal.headline: Creative Technologist & Quantitative Researcher
personal.tagline: Self-taught builder blending R, SQL, and real-world data to create tools with economic impact and community value.

about.bio: I'm a quantitative researcher and creative technologist with a background in economics and a passion for building tools that matter. My work bridges rigorous data analysis with human-centered design—from leading economic impact evaluations and building econometric models, to developing community-first tech platforms and applying machine learning to high-leverage domains like sports prediction and policy analysis. I bring a full-stack skill set across data science, web development, and economic modeling. I'm not a traditional engineer—but I learn what I need to ship what I care about, and I build with purpose.

education.degree: Master of Science in Quantitative Economics (MSQE)
Bachelor of Arts in Economics, Minor in International Relations
education.notes: Completed exchange program at University of Seoul, South Korea

education.degree: Associate of Arts in Economics, Behavioral & Social Sciences

experience.title: Founder & Developer
bullets: Built full-stack MVP from scratch while learning React, SQL, and deployment.
Designed schema, analytics strategy, and public launch plans for a vendor-driven app.

experience.title: Economic Consultant
experience.organization: SF Int'l Arts Festival & SF Pride
bullets: Led economic impact evaluations for major public events.
Designed and implemented research pipelines that supported renewed funding from the City of SF.

experience.title: Director of Research & Insights
experience.organization: FAME at San Francisco State University
bullets: Built custom analytics systems to support student engagement strategy.
Improved participation by over 35% through evidence-based insights.

experience.title: Bookkeeper
bullets: Provided financial record-keeping and forecasting for over 15 small businesses.
Generated insights for business owners via regular analysis and reporting.

experience.title: Operations Specialist
bullets: Supported retail operations and logistics across new product cycles.
Managed complex inventory systems to streamline sales and supply.

projects.title: Causal Analysis of NYC Congestion Pricing
projects.summary: Capstone causal study using DiD and Regression Discontinuity on traffic policy impacts.
projects.description: Led a capstone research project analyzing the impact of NYC congestion pricing using natural experiments. Published findings using R and Stata. Awarded 'Best Capstone'.

projects.title: 2024 San Francisco International Arts Festival Economic Impact Analysis
projects.summary: Economic impact evaluation for major public arts festival using causal inference methods.
projects.description: Conducted comprehensive economic impact analysis for the 2024 SF International Arts Festival. Used advanced econometric methods to measure direct and indirect economic effects on local businesses and tourism. Research supported renewed city funding.

projects.title: EV Demand Forecasting Model
projects.summary: Time series forecasting project analyzing EV adoption trends under different policy interventions.
projects.description: Built and validated a multi-model forecasting pipeline to estimate electric vehicle demand by region. Used the model to explore policy implications for sustainability efforts.

projects.title: F1 Betting Strategy Model
projects.summary: Statistical model for predicting Formula 1 race outcomes using historical performance data.
projects.description: Developed a comprehensive statistical model for Formula 1 race prediction using driver performance metrics, weather data, and circuit characteristics. Applied Bayesian updating techniques to improve prediction accuracy over time.

projects.title: Custom AI Infrastructure for PMI SF
projects.summary: Scalable AI infrastructure for customer service automation and workflow optimization.
projects.description: Designed and implemented a comprehensive AI infrastructure system for PMI to automate customer service workflows. Built scalable microservices architecture with real-time data processing and earned 'Most Innovative Project' recognition.

projects.title: Mushroom Classification Model
projects.summary: Deep learning model for automated mushroom species identification using computer vision.
projects.description: Built a convolutional neural network to classify mushroom species from images with 94% accuracy. Implemented data augmentation and transfer learning techniques to improve model performance on limited training data.

projects.title: Diabetes Classification Model
projects.summary: Machine learning model for early diabetes detection using clinical and demographic data.
projects.description: Developed a classification model to predict diabetes onset using patient health metrics and demographic information. Applied feature engineering and ensemble methods to achieve 89% accuracy while maintaining model interpretability for clinical use.

projects.title: NBA Performance Analytics
projects.summary: Advanced analytics platform for NBA player and team performance prediction.
projects.description: Built a comprehensive analytics platform to predict NBA player performance and team outcomes using historical statistics, injury data, and advanced metrics. Implemented machine learning models for both individual player projections and team success prediction.
